overview: 1993. USA. Directed by Paul Fusco. From The Magnum Eye. 11 min. Paul Fusco's Letting Go provides a poignant view of the AIDS crisis through the daily rounds at a San Francisco clinic in 1993.  Screened at the Museum of Modern Art in New York on July 1, 2017 as part of "Magnum Shorts: American Stories". Accompanies "Beyond the Frame: International Cinema by Magnum Photographers."
title: Letting Go
